comments:
In numerous places in Eclipse platform the right-click mouse button
does not open the context menu

This problem occurs only in Linux platform

For instance :
- Create a simple project
- Create a simple file
- Right-Click on this file. The context menu (open with ...) does not appear
Can you give more details about your install? Is this Red Hat Linux using Hebrew?
Also include the build id you are using (see the Help > About dialog).

(In reply to comment #2)
> Also include the build id you are using (see the Help > About dialog).

I am using Red Hat Enterprise Linux WS 4. I added Hebrew as Keyboard Input
Language : However I don't think this problem is related to Hebrew since 
the right click mouse button is not active even if Project and File names 
are English

I am using Eclipse 3.2.0 . Build Id: I20051215-1506

Are you saying that no context menu appears at all or that some menu items that you expect to be in the context menu are not there?  I was using a more recent build (I20060309-1000) on Linux-GTK and the context menu appears with all the menu items I expect.  Are there any additional changes (other than the keyboard) that were made to the system configuration?
Please don't remove the [BiDi] part of the bug title.  UI uses it to identify the UI component area of the bug.
Resolving as worksforme since no further info was provided and the menu appears for me in a more recent build than the one the bug was reported against.
The problem is still here for the build I20060327_0000
Is there anything in the log file?  This may be a result of bug 134689

(In reply to comment #9)
> Is there anything in the log file?  This may be a result of bug 134689

My Configuration is the following : I installed the target + assembly-for-rsa

I checked the log file and I noticed that each time I do right-click, I get the following exception:

I think this error is due to the fact that the Rational Requisite Pro is not installed on my machine (I even don't know if this product is available for Linux)

Anyway, this should not prevent the user from using the right-click menu.

It is not the same problem than bug 134689 because when I do right click, nothing happens (I don't get an error window or something like that)

Yes, it sounds like the reason you are seeing this problem could be due to the fact that you do not have this product installed.  If this is the case, the menu should not be prevented from being built.  Based on the fact that the existence of a library is being checked for in the stack frame:

com.ibm.xtools.reqpro.dataaccess.internal.api.util.RpApplicationUtil.loadRjcbBridges

I think this bug needs to be directed to a different product and component.  Need to determine which product and component owns the com.ibm.xtools.reqpro.dataaccess plugin.
Log a bug against RSA for this one - include the stack trace and info from comment #10.

I opened the defect RATLC00293885 against the DCS_linkability component.
It is solved now.

I am closing the defect.
